fields.value: Supplementary data for 'Chapter 4: High-resolution age modelling of ombrotrophic peat bog profiles from northern Alberta, using pre- and post-bomb 14C, 210Pb and historical cryptotephra'

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Supplementary files associated with PhD thesis Chapter 4 - High-resolution age modelling of ombrotrophic peat bog profiles from northern Alberta, using pre- and post-bomb 14C, 210Pb and historical cryptotephra.

Table S1: Individual major element EPMA glass shard analyses from this study.

Table S2: Secondary standard data for EPMA analyses.

Table S3: Radiocarbon standard data.

Table S4: a - Radiometric data for each core including the total and unsupported 210Pb, 226Ra, 137Cs and 241Am concentrations versus depth;
b - Resulting 210Pb dates, including corrections from reference dates (AD 1963, 1912) where relevant.

Table S5: Final age model output.

Figure S1: Flow diagram detailing the individual steps of the age-modelling procedure undertaken here.

Figure S2-7: Evolution of age-depth models for each site.
a) Raw dates, with no event boundaries or adjustments;
b) Raw dates with event boundaries;
c) Final models with outliers removed and tephra dates and corrected 210Pb included where relevant.

publicationCitation.value:
Supplementary data for Chapter 4 of:

Davies, LJ (2018) The development of a Holocene cryptotephra framework in northwestern North America. PhD Thesis, University of Alberta, Edmonton. doi.org/10.7939/R3HX1660C
